refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ocilogon returns an connection identifier needed for most other OCI calls. The optional third parameter can either contain the name of the local Oracle instance or the name of the entry in tnsnames.ora to which you want to connect. If the optional third parameter is not specified, PHP uses the environment variables ORACLE_SID (Oracle instance) or TWO_TASK (tnsnames.ora) to determine which database to connect to.
Connections are shared at the page level when using ocilogon. This means that commits and rollbacks apply to all open transactions in the page, even if you have created multiple connections.
